description.raw:
Currently optbuild doesn't cause a EX_TEMPFAIL exit from segway-task when gmtkViterbi is out of memory. Instead an exception like this is raised:

"optbuild.ReturncodeError: /mnt/work1/users/home2/mickaelm/lib/bin/gmtkViterbi returned 75"

The exception itself causes an error code of 1. We're more interested in getting the actual return code to see if we should resubmit due to out of memory.

This pull request also fixes the SIGKILL detection of segway-task.

Note that this doesn't attempt to catch the optbuild.SignalError. As in it doesn't catch a SIGKILL on gmtkViterbi. However the SIGKILL will catch on segway-task which runs gmtkViterbi.

No NEWS changes are needed since this falls under the news item:
"* segway: add and fix better job handling for segway-task (identify)"

Note that this doesn't attempt to catch the optbuild.SignalError. As in it doesn't catch a SIGKILL on gmtkViterbi. However the SIGKILL will catch on segway-task which runs gmtkViterbi.

No NEWS changes are needed since this falls under the news item: "* segway: add and fix better job handling for segway-task (identify)"

title.raw: Fix catching SIGKILL from segway-task and propagating non-zero exit status from gmtkViterbi
title.html: Fix catching SIGKILL from segway-task and propagating non-zero exit status from gmtkViterbi
